info.name: Scriptorium
info.description:
# ðŸ“„ Scriptorium API - CSC309 Project

Team: Henry, Alyssa, York

---

The Scriptorium API provides all the user management, code template management & execution, blogging and moderation functionalities for Scriptorium.

## **Getting started guide**

- For some endpoints, you will need a valid Bearer token in the header for authentication purposes. Some functionalities are restricted to users, specific users, or admins only.
    
- The base URL of this API is currently defined as `http://localhost:3000/api/` (the API currently does not support HTTPS).
    
- The API returns request responses in JSON format. When an API request returns an error, it is sent in the JSON response \[in the message or error key?\].
    

## Authentication

The Scriptorium API uses JWT for authentication. For endpoints which require this, it must be included in the header. You will receive an access token and a refresh token when logging in at `/api/accounts/login`, which are valid for one hour and one day respectively. If your refresh token is still valid, you may refresh your access token at `api/accounts/refresh`.

### Authentication error response

If an API key is missing, malformed, or invalid, you will receive an HTTP 401 Unauthorized response code.

item.name: Accounts

request.description:
### Request

- Method: POST
    
- Endpoint: {{baseUrl}}accounts/login
    
- Description: This endpoint is used to authenticate a user and obtain access and refresh tokens.
    

#### Request Body

- Type: Raw (application/json)
    
- Attributes:
    
    - username (string): The username of the user.
        
    - password (string): The password of the user.
        

### Response

- Attributes:
    
    - accessToken (string): The access token obtained after successful authentication.
        
    - refreshToken (string): The refresh token obtained after successful authentication.
        

#### JSON Schema

``` json
{
  "type": "object",
  "properties": {
    "accessToken": {
      "type": "string"
    },
    "refreshToken": {
      "type": "string"
    }
  }
}

 ```

response.name: Error
Deleted user attempt login

request.description:
### Register Account

This endpoint allows you to register a new account with the provided user details.

**Request Body**

- `username` (string, ): The username of the user. Required. "USERNAME SHOULD BE ALPHA-NUMERIC or underscore OF AT LEAST LENGTH 2
    
- `role` (string, ): The role of the user, which should be "USER". REquired
    
- `password` (string,): The password for the user. REquired. PASSWORD SHOULD BE AT LEAST 8 Characters, with 1 uppercase, 1 lowercase, 1 number, 1 special char
    
- `email` (string, ): The email address of the user. REquired. Valid email format
    
- `output_bool` (boolean,): A boolean value indicating whether full output is required. Optional
    
- `firstName` (string, : The first name of the \\ user. OPtional. At least 2 char
    
- `lastName` (string,): The last name of the user. Optional. at least 2 char
    
- `avatar` (string): The URL for the user's avatar image (or encoded image). Optional
    
- `phoneNumber` (string): The phone number of the user. OPtional. Valid phone format
    

**Response**

- `user` (object): An object containing user details.
    
    - `id` (integer): The unique identifier of the user.
        
    - `username` (string): The username of the registered user.
        
    - `role` (string): The role of the registered user.
        
    - `firstName` (string): The first name of the registered user.
        
    - `lastName` (string): The last name of the registered user.
        
    - `email` (string): The email address of the registered user.
        
    - `avatar` (string): The URL of the registered user's avatar image.
        
    - `phoneNumber` (string): The phone number of the registered user.
        
    - `createdAt` (string): The timestamp indicating the creation date of the account.
        

**Examples of Response**

1. `{"message":""}`
    
2. `{"user":{"id":0,"username":"","role":"","firstName":null,"lastName":null,"email":"","avatar":null,"phoneNumber":null,"createdAt":""}}`
    
3. `{"user":{"id":0,"username":"","role":"","firstName":"","lastName":"","email":"","avatar":"","phoneNumber":"","createdAt":""}}`

response.name: Must create account with user role
Password bad

request.description:
### Admin Register

This endpoint allows the registration of a new admin user or normal users.

#### Request Body

- `username` (string, ): The username of the user. Required. "USERNAME SHOULD BE ALPHA-NUMERIC or underscore OF AT LEAST LENGTH 2
    
- `role` (string, ): The role of the user, which should be "ADMIN" or "USER". REquired
    
- `password` (string,): The password for the user. REquired. PASSWORD SHOULD BE AT LEAST 8 Characters, with 1 uppercase, 1 lowercase, 1 number, 1 special char
    
- `email` (string, ): The email address of the user. REquired. Valid email format
    
- `output_bool` (boolean,): A boolean value indicating whether full output is required. Optional
    
- `firstName` (string, : The first name of the \\ user. OPtional. At least 2 char
    
- `lastName` (string,): The last name of the user. Optional. at least 2 char
    
- `avatar` (string): The URL for the user's avatar image (or encoded image). Optional
    
- `phoneNumber` (string): The phone number of the user. OPtional. Valid phone format
    

#### Response

The response will be in JSON format and will include the following fields:

- `user` (object): An object containing the details of the registered user, including the following fields:
    
    - `id` (number): The unique identifier of the user.
        
    - `username` (string): The username of the user.
        
    - `role` (string): The role of the user.
        
    - `firstName` (string): The first name of the user.
        
    - `lastName` (string): The last name of the user.
        
    - `email` (string): The email address of the user.
        
    - `avatar` (string): The URL for the user's avatar image.
        
    - `phoneNumber` (string): The phone number of the user.
        
    - `createdAt` (string): The timestamp indicating the creation date of the user.
        

#### Example Response Schema

``` json
{
  "type": "object",
  "properties": {
    "user": {
      "type": "object",
      "properties": {
        "id": { "type": "number" },
        "username": { "type": "string" },
        "role": { "type": "string" },
        "firstName": { "type": "string" },
        "lastName": { "type": "string" },
        "email": { "type": "string" },
        "avatar": { "type": "string" },
        "phoneNumber": { "type": "string" },
        "createdAt": { "type": "string" }
      }
    }
  }
}

 ```

response.name: Must create either user or admin

request.description:
### Admin Users Creation (For manual creation, essentially a duplicate of Admin account creation)

This endpoint allows the creation of admin users or normal users.

#### Request Body

- `username` (string) - The username of the admin user.
    
- `role` (string) - The role of the admin user.
    
- `password` (string) - The password of the admin user.
    
- `email` (string) - The email of the admin user.
    
- `output_bool` (boolean) - Indicates whether to include a specific output.
    

#### Response

The response will be in JSON format and follows the schema below:

``` json
{
  "user": {
    "id": 0,
    "username": "",
    "role": "",
    "firstName": null,
    "lastName": null,
    "email": "",
    "avatar": null,
    "phoneNumber": null,
    "createdAt": ""
  }
}

 ```

This endpoint allows the registration of a new admin user.

#### Request Body

- `username` (string, ): The username of the user. Required. "USERNAME SHOULD BE ALPHA-NUMERIC or underscore OF AT LEAST LENGTH 2
    
- `role` (string, ): The role of the user, which should be "ADMIN" or "USER". REquired
    
- `password` (string,): The password for the user. REquired. PASSWORD SHOULD BE AT LEAST 8 Characters, with 1 uppercase, 1 lowercase, 1 number, 1 special char
    
- `email` (string, ): The email address of the user. REquired. Valid email format
    
- `output_bool` (boolean,): A boolean value indicating whether full output is required. Optional
    
- `firstName` (string, : The first name of the \\ user. OPtional. At least 2 char
    
- `lastName` (string,): The last name of the user. Optional. at least 2 char
    
- `avatar` (string): The URL for the user's avatar image (or encoded image). Optional
    
- `phoneNumber` (string): The phone number of the user. OPtional. Valid phone format
    

#### Response

The response will be in JSON format and will include the following fields:

- `user` (object): An object containing the details of the registered user, including the following fields:
    
    - `id` (number): The unique identifier of the user.
        
    - `username` (string): The username of the user.
        
    - `role` (string): The role of the user.
        
    - `firstName` (string): The first name of the user.
        
    - `lastName` (string): The last name of the user.
        
    - `email` (string): The email address of the user.
        
    - `avatar` (string): The URL for the user's avatar image.
        
    - `phoneNumber` (string): The phone number of the user.
        
    - `createdAt` (string): The timestamp indicating the creation date of the user.
        

#### Example Response Schema

``` json
{
  "type": "object",
  "properties": {
    "user": {
      "type": "object",
      "properties": {
        "id": { "type": "number" },
        "username": { "type": "string" },
        "role": { "type": "string" },
        "firstName": { "type": "string" },
        "lastName": { "type": "string" },
        "email": { "type": "string" },
        "avatar": { "type": "string" },
        "phoneNumber": { "type": "string" },
        "createdAt": { "type": "string" }
      }
    }
  }
}

 ```

response.name: Role must be admin or user

request.description:
### Retrieve User Profile

This endpoint is used to retrieve the user profile information. User should be logged in, and can only see their own profile

#### Request

This is a GET request used to fetch user profile data from the endpoint. There is no request body for a GET request.

#### Response

The response will have a `200 OK` status code and will include the following JSON schema:

``` json
{
  "user": {
    "username": "",
    "firstName": null,
    "lastName": null,
    "email": "",
    "avatar": null,
    "phoneNumber": null,
    "createdAt": "",
    "updatedAt": "",
    "deleted": true,
    "role": ""
  }
}

 ```

#### Related Responses

Other endpoints of this API return similar data models, including:

``` json
{
  "accessToken": "",
  "refreshToken": ""
}

 ```

response.name: Case sensitive

body.raw:
{
    "username": "user",
    "page": 1,
    "pageSize": 3,
    "fistName_bool": true,
    "lastName_bool": true,
    "email_bool": true,
    "avatar_bool": true,
    "phoneNumber_bool": true,
    "createdAt_bool": true,
    "role_bool":true
}

request.description:
### Get User Accounts

This endpoint retrieves user accounts (all that have usernames containing the username, non case sensitive) with the option to specify pagination parameters.

**Request:**

- Method: GET
    
- Endpoint: {{baseUrl}}accounts/users
    
- Query Parameters:
    
    - `username` (string, required): The username of the user
        
    - `page` (integer, optional): The page number for pagination
        
    - `pageSize` (integer,optional): The number of items per page
        
    - `fistName_bool` (boolean, optional): Include first name in the response
        
    - `lastName_bool` (boolean, optional): Include last name in the response
        
    - `email_bool` (boolean, optional): Include email in the response
        
    - `avatar_bool` (boolean, optional): Include avatar in the response
        
    - `phoneNumber_bool` (boolean, optional): Include phone number in the response
        
    - `createdAt_bool` (boolean, optional): Include creation date in the response
        
    - `role_bool` (boolean,optional): Include user role in the response
        

**Response:**

``` json
{
  "type": "array",
  "items": {
    "type": "object",
    "properties": {
      "username": {
        "type": "string"
      },
      "deleted": {
        "type": "boolean"
      }
    }
  }
}

 ```

**Related Responses:**

- Endpoint: {{baseUrl}}/auth/token
    
    - { "type": "object", "properties": { "accessToken": { "type": "string" }, "refreshToken": { "type": "string" } }}
        
- Status Code: 200

response.name: Success full output

body.raw:
{
    "username": "user",
    "page": 1,
    "pageSize": 3,
    "fistName_bool": true,
    "lastName_bool": true,
    "email_bool": true,
    "avatar_bool": true,
    "phoneNumber_bool": true,
    "createdAt_bool": true,
    "role_bool":true
}

request.description:
### Update User Profile

This endpoint is used to update the user profile details. User must be logged in, can only edit their profile. Use admin edit to edit any profile at more details. All changes must satisfy original account creation constraints

#### Request Body

- `username` (string): The username of the user. Optional
    
- `firstName` (string): The first name of the user. Optional
    
- `lastName` (string): The last name of the user. Optional
    
- `avatar` (string): The avatar of the user. Optional
    
- `phoneNumber` (string): The phone number of the user. Optional
    

#### Response

Upon a successful update, the API returns a status code of 201 along with the updated user object containing the following fields:

- `username` (string): The username of the user.
    
- `firstName` (string): The first name of the user.
    
- `lastName` (string): The last name of the user.
    
- `email` (string): The email of the user.
    
- `avatar` (string): The avatar of the user.
    
- `phoneNumber` (string): The phone number of the user.
    
- `role` (string): The role of the user.
    
- `createdAt` (string): The timestamp of user creation.
    
- `updatedAt` (string): The timestamp of the last update.
    
- `deleted` (boolean): Indicates if the user is deleted.
    

#### Example Response

``` json
{
    "updated_user": {
        "username": "",
        "firstName": "",
        "lastName": "",
        "email": "",
        "avatar": "",
        "phoneNumber": "",
        "role": "",
        "createdAt": "",
        "updatedAt": "",
        "deleted": true
    }
}

 ```

### Update Admin User

This endpoint allows the admin to update user details. Can edit any user based on username, must use AUTH with access token. All changes must satisfy original account creation constraints

#### Request Body

- `username` (string, required): The username of the user to be edited.
    
- `role` (string, optional): The role of the user.
    
- `password` (string, roptional): The password of the user.
    
- `email` (string,optionald): The email of the user.
    
- `firstName` (string, optional): The first name of the user.
    
- `lastName` (string,optional): The last name of the user.
    
- `avatar` (string, roptional): The URL of the user's avatar.
    
- `phoneNumber` (string, optional): The phone number of the user.
    
- newUsername: (string, optional): new username of user
    

#### Response (JSON Schema)

``` json
{
    "type": "object",
    "properties": {
        "updated_user": {
            "type": "object",
            "properties": {
                "id": { "type": "integer" },
                "username": { "type": "string" },
                "role": { "type": "string" },
                "firstName": { "type": "string" },
                "lastName": { "type": ["string", "null"] },
                "email": { "type": "string" },
                "avatar": { "type": ["string", "null"] },
                "phoneNumber": { "type": ["string", "null"] },
                "createdAt": { "type": "string" },
                "updatedAt": { "type": "string" }
            }
        }
    }
}

 ```

### Delete User Profile

This endpoint is used to delete the user's profile. Can only delete the profile/account of the currently logged in user (must provide access token in aAUTH). This is a shallow deletion!

**Request**

- Method: DELETE
    
- Endpoint: {{baseUrl}}/accounts/profile
    

**Response**

- Status: 200 OK
    
- { "message": ""
    

**Related Responses**

- { "updated_user": { "username": "", "firstName": "", "lastName": "", "email": "", "avatar": "", "phoneNumber": "", "role": "", "createdAt": "", "updatedAt": "", "deleted": true }
    
- { "accessToken": "", "refreshToken": ""}

item.description: The /api/accounts/ endpoints are for account management.

item.name: Code Templates

request.description:
Executes code, passing in provided input to the program and returning the program output.

**Body**

- code (string) _(required)_: the code to execute.
    
- language (string) _(required)_: the language which the code is written in. Accepts any of \["python", "javascript", "c", "cpp", "java"\].
    
- input (array of strings) _(required)_: the inputs to be passed, individually, into stdin of the process. Should be an empty array if no input is to be passed in.

response.name: Invalid Language

request.description:
Creates, or forks, a code template. Accessible only to authenticated users. Returns the new template object.

**Body**

- title (string) _(required)_: the title of the code template. Duplicates are allowed.
    
- forkedSourceId (number): the ID of the code template which the current template is forked from. If defined, the content and language of the code template is copied from the source.
    
- language (string): the language which the code will be written in. Required if forkedSourceId is not defined.
    
- explanation (string): the explanation of the code template.
    
- tags (array of strings): the tags to be associated with the template.

response.name: Invalid Tags Format

request.description:
Searches and returns a paginated list of code templates with the given filters. Code content is not contained in the response.

**Parameters**

- page (number) _(required)_: the current page of results to return
    
- pageSize (number) _(required)_: the number of code templates to return in each page
    
- title (string): the code template titles to (partially) match
    
- content (string): the code template content to (partially) match
    
- author (string): the username of template authors to (partially) match
    
- tags (array of strings): the tags of code templates to (completely) match

request.description:
Saves edits to a code template. Accessible only to the authenticated author of the code template, and admins. Returns the new code template object.

**Body**

- id (string) _(required)_: the id of the code template to update
    
- title (string): the new title of the template to replace with
    
- explanation (string): the new explanation of the template to replace with
    
- tags (array of strings): the new list of tags to replace with
    
- content (string): the new code to replace with

response.name: Not Author of Template

request.description:
(Shadow) deletes a code template. Accessible only to the authenticated author of the code template, and admins.

**Body**

- id (string): the ID of the code template to delete.

Finds and returns the full template object.

**Parameters**

- id _(required)_: the ID of the code template to return.

item.description: The `api/templates/` endpoints allow any user to find and execute code templates, and for authenticated users to create, edit and delete their own code templates.
